source_sentence: 起世因本經卷第七
translation: Qishi jingben ben jing, vol. 7

source_sentence: 隋天竺沙門達摩笈多譯
translation: Translated by the Sui translator Dharmagupta, a renunciant of India

source_sentence: 三十三天品中
translation: within the Chapter on the Thirty-three Gods

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 又彼園中，有何因緣，名為歡喜？
translation: Again, what is the reason it's called joyful?

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 彼歡喜園，三十三天王入其中已，坐於歡喜及善歡喜二石之上，心受歡喜，
translation: Having entered the park of joy, the king of the thirty-three gods sat on the two rocks joyful and well-joyed.

source_sentence: 意念歡喜，念已復念，心受悅樂，受悅樂已，復受悅樂，是故彼稱為歡喜園。
translation: Their minds are joyful, and when they think of it, they're also joyful; and when they're happy, they're also happy. That's why they're called the joyous park.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 又復彼樹有何因緣，名波利夜多囉拘毘陀羅樹？
translation: Again, what is the reason that this tree is called the pārijātaka-kuvidāra tree?

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 其波利夜多囉拘毘陀羅樹下，有天子住，名曰末多，日夜常以彼天種種五欲功德具足和合遊戲受樂，
translation: At the foot of the pārijātaka-kauṇḍinya tree there lived a celestial being named Mathu, who enjoyed all kinds of pleasures and games day and night in harmony with the virtues of the five desires of that god.

source_sentence: 是故彼天稱彼為波利夜多囉拘毘陀羅樹。
translation: That's why the gods call it the pārijātaka kovidāra tree.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 又復三十三天隨急疾時，未曾離彼般茶甘婆石，唯設供養尊重恭敬，隨心所欲，
translation: Again, when the thirty-three gods were suffering from an acute illness, they never left that paṇḍa甘婆石. They offered only offerings of respect and veneration, according to their mentalities and desires.

source_sentence: 去處即去。
translation: Where he goes, he's going.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 以此石是如來昔日所住處故。
translation: Because this stone was the place where the Tathāgata lived in the past.

source_sentence: 彼諸天取為支提塔，一切世間天人魔梵沙門婆羅門等供養故。
translation: Those gods take it as a stūpa of caitya and make offerings to all the gods, humans, Māra, Brahmā, ascetics, priests, and brāhmaṇas in the world.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 有三十三天，唯眼得見波婁沙迦園，身不得入。
translation: Only the thirty-three gods can see the park of Parusaka with their eyes, but they can't enter it with their body.

source_sentence: 身不入故，不得彼處五欲功德受具足樂。
translation: Because the body doesn't enter, they won't be able to experience the full happiness of the five desires and merits in those places.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 彼處業勝，以其前世作善根劣故不得入。
translation: Their karma in that place is superior because their good roots of past lives are weak and they can't enter it.

source_sentence: 有三十三天，得見波婁沙迦園，身亦得入。
translation: The thirty-three gods were able to see the park of Parusaka, and their bodies were also able to enter it.

source_sentence: 既得入已，具得以天種種五欲和合功德具足而受同體快樂。
translation: Having entered them, they'll be able to enter the heavens with various five desires combined with their merits and experience the same essence of happiness.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 以其善根增上勝故。
translation: It's because their good roots are superior.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 有三十三天，眼不得見雜色車園，身亦不入，亦不得以彼園五欲和合功德具足同體而受快樂。
translation: There are thirty-three gods whose eyes can't see the park of a chariot of mixed colors, and their bodies won't enter it, nor can they experience happiness with the same body that's endowed with the five desires combined with the merits of those parks.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 以其善根有別異故。
translation: It's because their good roots have distinctive differences.

source_sentence: 又有三十三天，眼雖得見雜色車園，身不得入，亦不得以彼園五欲和合功德具足同體而受快樂。
translation: Again, in the thirty-three heavens, even though their eyes can see a park of chariots of mixed colors, their bodies can't enter it, and they can't experience happiness with the same body that's endowed with the five desires combined with the merits of those parks.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 以其善根有優劣故。
translation: It's because their good roots have superiority and inferiority.

source_sentence: 又有三十三天，眼既得見雜色車園，身亦得入。
translation: Again, the thirty-three gods can see the chariot park of mixed colors with their eyes, and their bodies can enter as well.

source_sentence: 既得入已，具足得彼種種五欲同體和合快樂而受。
translation: Having entered it, they'll be fully endowed with the various five desires that are experienced by combining the same essence and happiness of the five desires.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 以其善根增上勝故。
translation: It's because their good roots are superior.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 諸是一切三十三天，並得見於雜亂園苑，亦皆得入，既得入已，悉共同得彼園苑中種種五欲和合功德同體快樂具足而受。
translation: All of these thirty-three gods can see the park in a mixed garden, and they can enter it. Having entered it, they'll all attain various kinds of five desires that are combined with the sameness of merit and happiness in those parks and pleasures, and they'll experience them.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 彼處無有別異善根修行等故。
translation: There's no distinctive cultivation of the good roots and so forth in those places.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 有三十三天，不得見歡喜園，亦不得入，亦不得以彼園苑中種種五欲和合功德同體快樂具足而受。
translation: There are the thirty-three gods who can't see the park of joy, enter it, or experience it because the various five desires combine to produce the same body and happiness with the same virtues in those parks and pleasures.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 彼處果報前世造時業別異故。
translation: It's because the karmic retribution of those places is distinct and different when they were created in a previous life.

source_sentence: 又有三十三天，得見歡喜園，唯不得入，亦不得彼歡喜園中種種五欲和合功德同體快樂具足而受。
translation: Again, the thirty-three gods were able to see the pleasure grove but could not enter it. Nor could they enter and experience the pleasure grove filled with the various pleasures of the five desires combined with the same essence of virtue and bliss.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 彼於彼處，業別異故。
translation: Their action differs from one place to another.

source_sentence: 又有三十三天得見歡喜園，其身亦入，既入彼已，具足得彼種種五欲和合功德同體快樂，
translation: Again, the thirty-three gods were able to see the pleasure grove and their bodies also entered it. Having entered it, they were fully endowed with the happiness that is the same in essence as all those five kinds of desires combined with one another:

source_sentence: 並皆受之。
translation: They all accepted it.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 彼於彼處，造諸善業，所熏修時無別異故。
translation: Because there is no distinction in the moments of permeation and cultivation of good action wherein they produce it.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 其善法堂三十三天聚會處所，有二岐道；
translation: At the place where the thirty-three gods congregated in the Hall of Good Dharma, there were two different paths.

source_sentence: 帝釋天王宮殿處所，有二岐道；
translation: Where Indra the king of gods resided in his palace there were two different paths.

source_sentence: 諸小天王，并諸官屬，三十三天宮殿處所，亦二岐道；
translation: The lesser celestial kings and their officials, the palaces of the thirty-three gods and their quarters are also located in two different directions.

source_sentence: 伊羅婆那大龍象王宮殿處所，亦二岐道；
translation: The abode of the great dragon and elephant king Airāvana in his palace was also on two different paths.

source_sentence: 波婁沙迦園，亦二岐道；
translation: The grove of palmuṣakā trees is also twofold.

source_sentence: 雜色車園及雜亂園、歡喜園池等，一一亦各有二岐道；
translation: The parks of carts of various colors, the parks of mixed distraction, the parks of delight and joy, and so on, each one also had two courses.

source_sentence: 波利夜多囉拘毘陀羅大樹，亦二岐道。
translation: The great pārijātaka kovidāra tree also has two paths.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 其帝釋天王，若欲向於波婁沙迦園及雜色車、歡喜園等，澡浴歡樂遊戲行時，
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra, if he wants to go to the park of Parusāraka, the park of various colors and carriages, the park of joy, or other parks where he bathes, plays, and enjoys himself,

source_sentence: 爾時心念伊羅婆那大龍象王。
translation: It was then that he thought of the great dragon elephant king Elāvana in his mind.

source_sentence: 其伊羅婆那大龍象王亦生是念：『帝釋天王心念於我。』
translation: The great dragon elephant king Elāvana also had this thought, 'The god Indra the King of Gods is mindful of me.'

source_sentence: 如是知已，從其宮出，即自變化，作三十三頭；
translation: Knowing this, he came out of the palace and magically transformed himself into thirty-three forms.

source_sentence: 其一一頭，化作六牙；
translation: Each hair on the head was transformed into six tusks.

source_sentence: 一一牙上，化作七池，一一池中，各有七華；
translation: On the top of each tooth he magically created seven ponds. In each pond were seven flowers.

source_sentence: 一一華上，各七玉女；
translation: On each flower there were seven jadelike maidens.

source_sentence: 一一玉女，各復自有七女為侍。
translation: Each of the jade maidens had seven other maidservants as their attendants.

source_sentence: 爾時，伊羅婆那大龍象王，化作如是諸神變已，即便詣向帝釋王所，到已在彼帝釋前住。
translation: It was then that the great dragon elephant king Elāvana, having created such miraculous transformations, went to Indra and stayed in front of him.

source_sentence: 「爾時，帝釋天王心念諸小三十二天王，并三十二諸天眾等。
translation: At the time, Śakra Devānām-Indra was mindful of the thirty-two minor heavenly kings and the thirty-two celestial beings.

source_sentence: 時，彼小王及諸天眾亦生是心：『帝釋天王今念我等。』
translation: The lesser kings and the gods then also had this thought, 'Now, Śakra Devānām-Indra is mindful of us.'

source_sentence: 如是知已，各以種種眾妙瓔珞莊嚴其身，俱乘種種車乘，詣向天帝釋邊，
translation: Having thus known, each adorned his body with various beautiful jewelry, they all rode in various chariots to the side of Sakka, lord of the gods.

source_sentence: 到已各各在前而住。
translation: When they arrived, each was standing in front of the other.

source_sentence: 時，天帝釋見已，即自種種嚴身，服眾瓔珞，前後左右，以諸天眾，周匝圍遶，
translation: Having seen this, the lord of the gods adorned themselves in various ways and dressed themselves with jewelry, surrounded by heavenly beings.

source_sentence: 即便昇上伊羅婆那龍象王上，帝釋天王正當中央真頭上坐，左右兩邊各有十六諸小天王，
translation: He ascended to the throne of Indra, king of gods, seated on his right and left sides with sixteen minor celestial kings.

source_sentence: 悉同乘彼伊羅婆那龍象王化頭之上，各各而坐。
translation: They all rode together on top of the transformation heads of the dragon-and-elephant king Airāvana and each sat there.

source_sentence: 時，天帝釋導從天眾，向波婁沙迦及雜色車，并雜亂園、歡喜園等，到已而住。
translation: Śakra, lord of the gods, accompanied by a multitude of gods, then proceeded toward Pāruṣaka and the chariots of various colors, as well as the park of mixed disorder and the park of joy. Having arrived there, he stayed.

source_sentence: 其歡喜等四園之中，皆有三種風輪而持，謂開、淨、吹，略說如前，開門、淨地及吹花等。
translation: Among the four parks of joy and so on, there are all three kinds of wind-wheels that support them: open, clean, and blowing. The brief explanation is as before:

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 彼等園中，既吹花散遍地至膝，其花香氣處處普熏。
translation: In those parks, they blow flowers all over the ground up to their knees, and their flowers have a fragrance that permeates everywhere.

source_sentence: 於時帝釋共小天王三十三天眷屬圍遶，入雜色車、歡喜園等，嬉戲受樂，
translation: Śakra, lord of the gods, surrounded by the thirty-three deva kings and their retinues, entered a chariot drawn in various colors.

source_sentence: 隨意遊行，或臥或坐。
translation: He walks around as he wishes, either lying or sitting.

source_sentence: 時，帝釋天王欲得瓔珞，即念毘守羯磨天子。
translation: Desiring to obtain the necklace, Śakra Devānām-Indra then thought of the deity Viśvakarman.

source_sentence: 時彼天子即便化作眾寶瓔珞，奉上天王。
translation: That celestial prince then transformed himself into a necklace of many treasures and presented it to the king of heaven.

source_sentence: 若三十三天眷屬等須瓔珞者，毘守羯磨皆悉化作而供給之。
translation: If the thirty-three gods' retinues and other necessities need a necklace, Vaiśravaṇa transforms them all into offerings.

source_sentence: 欲聞音聲及伎樂者，則有諸鳥，出種種音，聲甚和雅，令天樂聞。
translation: Those who want to hear sounds and tricks, then some birds produce various sounds that are so harmonious that the gods delight in hearing them.

source_sentence: 天於彼時如是受樂，一日乃至七日，一月乃至三月，種種歡娛，澡浴嬉戲，
translation: For one day, up to seven days, for a month, and up to three months, the gods enjoy various kinds of entertainment, bathing, playing, and frolicking.

source_sentence: 行住坐臥，隨意東西。
translation: He walks, stands, sits, and lies down as he wishes.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 帝釋天王有十天子，常為守護。
translation: Indra the king of gods had ten celestial sons who always guarded him.

source_sentence: 何等為十？
translation: What are these ten?

source_sentence: 一名因陀羅迦、二名瞿波迦、三名頻頭迦、四名頻頭婆迦、五名阿俱吒迦、六名吒都多迦、七名時婆迦、八名胡盧祇那、九名難茶迦、十名胡盧婆迦。
translation: One is named Indraka, two are named Kapotaka, three are named Bimbisāra, four are named Bimbisāra, five are named Akūṭaka, six are named Tathāgata, seven are named時婆迦, eight are named Hrūḍayana, nine are named Nandhaka, and ten are named Hroṣṭrapāla

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 其天帝釋常為如是十天子護，恒隨左右，不曾捨離，以守護故。
translation: Śakra, lord of the gods, always guarded by these ten guardian gods, always accompanied them to their sides without ever leaving them.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 閻浮提地，為諸人輩有水生諸華，最上精妙極可愛者，所謂優鉢羅花、鉢陀摩花、究牟陀花、奔茶梨迦花，
translation: In Jambudvīpa, there are flowers that grow from water for the sake of all living beings. The most exquisitely beautiful and most desirable is the utpala flower, padma flower, kumuda flower, and puṇḍarīka flower.

source_sentence: 其花香氣氤氳軟美；
translation: The flowers had a fragrant odor that dazzled the world with their soft beauty.

source_sentence: 其陸生華，最極好者，所謂阿提目多迦華、瞻波迦華、波吒羅花、蘇摩那華、婆利師迦花、摩利迦華、摩頭揵提迦華、搔揵提迦花、遊提迦華、殊低沙迦利迦花、陀奴沙迦膩迦花等。
translation: The most exquisite of these flowers are the adhimukti, campaka, puṇḍarīka, pāṭala, sumanā, pāriṣṭika, mālīka, mudpuṇḍarīka, rājagṛha, yogâcāra, jīvaka, ūrṣa-kālikā, and nāsākrāmanīka.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 瞿陀尼人輩，有水生花，最極好者，所謂優鉢羅花、鉢陀摩花、究牟陀花、奔茶梨迦花，
translation: The people of [Apara]godānīya have flowers growing from the water. The most exquisite are the utpala, padma, kumuda, and puṇḍalīka flowers.

source_sentence: 香氣氛馥，處處熏人；
translation: It was fragrant, permeating people everywhere.

source_sentence: 其陸生華，最香好者，所謂阿提目多迦華、瞻波迦花、波吒羅花、蘇摩那花、婆利師迦花、摩利迦花、摩頭揵提迦花、搔揵提迦花、遊提迦花、殊低沙迦利迦華、陀奴沙迦膩迦花等。
translation: The most fragrant and beautiful among the flowers grown on land are the adhimukta flowers, campaka flowers, pāṭala flowers, sumanā flowers, pāriṣṭika flowers, mālīka flowers, mudpuṇḍarīka flowers, rāja flowers, yucika flowers, jīvaka flowers, duṣākālikā flowers, dhāraṇī kaṇyaka flowers,

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 其弗婆提諸人輩，有水生之華，最極好者，所謂優鉢羅花、鉢陀摩花、究牟陀華、奔茶梨迦花，
translation: Among the people of Pūrvavideha there were many water lilies, the most beautiful of which were the blue lotus blossoms (upāla), white lotus blossoms (padma), pink lotus blossoms ( kumbhūṣa), and flowering lotuses (puṇḍarīka).

source_sentence: 極甚光鮮，香氣普熏；
translation: It was extremely brilliant and fragrant, with an odor that permeated all directions.

source_sentence: 其陸生花，最極好者，所謂阿提目多迦花、瞻波迦華、波吒羅花、蘇摩那華、婆利師迦花、摩利迦花、摩頭揵提迦華、搔揵提迦華、遊提迦花、殊低沙迦利迦花、陀奴沙迦膩迦華等。
translation: The most beautiful of the flowers growing on land are called the atimutaka flower, campaka flower, paṭala flower, sumana flower, vāriṣika flower, mārika flower, mudpuṇḍarīka flower, rājagṛha flower, jīvaka flower, śubha-kālīka flower, dhāraṇī-

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 其欝多羅究留人輩，有水生花，最極好者，所謂優鉢羅花、鉢陀摩花、究牟陀華、奔茶梨迦花，
translation: Among the people of Uttarakuru there are some that grow water flower blossoms. The most exquisite among them are the utpala, padma, kumuda, and puṇḍarīka flowers.

source_sentence: 香氣柔軟；
translation: Its fragrance is gentle and soft.

source_sentence: 其陸生華，最極好者，所謂阿提目多迦華、瞻波迦華、波吒羅華、蘇摩那花、婆利師迦花、摩利迦花、摩頭揵提迦華、搔揵提迦華、遊提迦花、殊低沙迦利迦花、陀奴沙迦膩迦花等。
translation: The most exquisite of these flowers are the adhimukti, campaka, pāṭala, sumanā, pāriṣṭika, mālīka, mudpuṇḍarīka, rājagṛha, yogâcāra, jīvaka, upāsaka, daṇuṣa-kālikā, and nāsa-kānikā.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 其諸龍等及金翅鳥，亦各皆有水生之花，最極好者，所謂優鉢羅花、鉢陀摩花、究牟陀花、奔茶梨迦華，
translation: The dragons and other garuḍas as well as the birds with golden wings also each had flowers growing from water. The most exquisite of these were the utpala, padma, kumuda, and puṇḍarīka flowers.

source_sentence: 香氣氛氳，柔軟美妙；
translation: Its fragrance and odor are delicate, soft, sweet, and wonderful.

source_sentence: 其陸生花，最極好者，所謂阿提目多迦花、瞻波迦花、波吒羅花、蘇摩那花、婆利師迦華、摩利迦花、摩頭揵提迦花、搔揵提迦花、遊提迦花、殊低沙迦利迦花、羯迦羅利迦花、摩訶羯迦羅利迦花等。
translation: The most exquisite of the native flowers are the adhimukti, campaka, pāṭala, sumanā, pāriṣṭika, mālīka, mudpuṇḍarīka, rājagṛha, yogâcāra, jīvaka, kṣatriya, kaṭikā, mahākāṭikā, and mahākāṭikā.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！

source_sentence: 其世間人，有七種色。
translation: The people of that world have seven kinds of form.

source_sentence: 何等為七？
translation: What are these seven?

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 有諸人輩，火色火形、金色金形、青色青形、赤色赤形、白色白形、黃色黃形、黑色黑形，
translation: There were some people in the assembly whose forms were like fire, those of fiery color, those of golden color, those of gold color, those of blue color, those of blue color, those of red color, those of white color, those of white color, those of yellow color, those of yellow color, and those of black-and-white color.

source_sentence: 譬如魔梵常色。
translation: It's like the constant form of Māra and Brahmā.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 世間人有此七種色，諸阿修羅，亦復如是，有此七色；
translation: People in the world have these seven kinds of colors. The same applies to the asura demons:

source_sentence: 諸天眾等，亦復有此七種之色，譬如魔梵常色。
translation: Gods and goddesses also have these seven kinds of form, which are like the eternal form of Māra and Brahmā.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 諸天別有十種之法。
translation: The gods have ten distinct kinds of dharmas.

source_sentence: 何等為十？
translation: What are these ten?

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 一諸天行來去無邊；
translation: One is the boundlessness of the coming and going of all celestial beings.

source_sentence: 二諸天行來去無礙；
translation: The second is the unobstructed movement of celestial beings, coming and going.

source_sentence: 三諸天行無有遲疾；
translation: The third is the absence of delay in the movements of the gods.

source_sentence: 四諸天行脚無蹤跡；
translation: The four heavenly beings had no footprints when they walked.

source_sentence: 五諸天身無患疲乏；
translation: The bodies of the five celestial beings had no trouble or weariness.

source_sentence: 六諸天身有形無影；
translation: The bodies of the six celestial beings have form but no shape.

source_sentence: 七諸天無大小便；
translation: The seventh is that the gods have no excretion or urination.

source_sentence: 八諸天身無有涕唾；
translation: The bodies of the eight celestial beings were not covered with tears or spittle.

source_sentence: 九諸天身清淨微妙，無有脂髓皮肉及血筋骨脈等；
translation: The bodies of the nine celestial beings were pure and subtle, without fat, marrow, skin, flesh, blood, tendons, bones, veins, etc.

source_sentence: 十諸天身欲現長短青黃赤白大小麤細，隨意悉能，並皆端正，可喜殊絕，
translation: The ten heavenly bodies, whether long or short, blue, yellow, red, white, coarse or fine, large or small, can appear as they wish. All of them are beautiful and pleasing to be seen.

source_sentence: 令人愛樂。
translation: It causes people to love it.

source_sentence: 諸天之身，有此十種不可思議。
translation: These are the ten kinds of inconceivable bodies of the gods.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 又諸天身，充實不虛，悉皆平滿。
translation: The bodies of the gods were all perfectly proportioned and not unreal.

source_sentence: 齒白方密，髮青齊整。
translation: The teeth are white and square in color but dense; they are evenly arranged in blue.

source_sentence: 柔軟光澤，身自然明。
translation: It was soft, shiny, and naturally luminous.

source_sentence: 有神通力，飛騰虛空，眼視不瞬。
translation: He possessed supernatural powers and flew up into the sky without blinking when looked at with his eyes.

source_sentence: 瓔珞自然，衣無垢膩。
translation: The necklace is natural, and the robes are without dirt or grease.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 閻浮提人，壽命百年，其間有夭；
translation: The people of Jambudvīpa have a life span of one hundred years, but some die young.

source_sentence: 瞿陀尼人，壽二百年，中亦有夭；
translation: The people of Godānī have a life span of two hundred years, but some also die young.

source_sentence: 弗婆提人壽三百年，中亦有夭；
translation: The people of Pūrvavideha have a life span of three hundred years, but some also die young.

source_sentence: 欝多囉究留人，定壽千年，無有夭殤；
translation: The people of Uttarakuru have a fixed life span of one thousand years, but no deaths occur.

source_sentence: 閻摩羅世諸眾生，壽七萬二千歲，中亦有夭；
translation: Sentient beings in Jambudvīpa have a life span of seventy-thousand years, but some also die young.

source_sentence: 諸龍及金翅鳥，壽命一劫，中亦有夭；
translation: The duration of life of the nāgas and garuḍas is one kalpa, in which they also die.

source_sentence: 阿修羅壽，同天千年，中間亦夭；
translation: The duration of life of the asuras is the same as that of gods, being one thousand years in length.

source_sentence: 四天王壽五百歲，中亦有夭；
translation: The duration of life of the four guardians of the heavens is five hundred years.

source_sentence: 三十三天，壽命千歲；
translation: The Trāyastriṃśa gods have a life span of one thousand years.

source_sentence: 夜摩諸天，壽二千歲；
translation: The Yama gods had a life span of two thousand years.

source_sentence: 兜率陀天，壽四千歲；
translation: The Tuṣita gods have a life span of four thousand years.

source_sentence: 化樂諸天，壽八千歲；
translation: The Nirmāṇarati gods had a life span of eight thousand years.

source_sentence: 他化自在天，壽十六千歲；
translation: The Paranirmitavaśavartin gods have a life span of sixteen thousand years.

source_sentence: 魔身天，壽三萬二千歲；
translation: The Māra-body gods had a life span of thirty-two thousand years.

source_sentence: 梵身天壽一劫；
translation: The celestial life span of the Brahmakāyika gods is one kalpa.

source_sentence: 光憶念天，壽命二劫；
translation: The Guṇamatideva has a life span of two world ages.

source_sentence: 遍淨諸天，壽命四劫；
translation: The Śubhakṛtsnas had a life span of four world ages.

source_sentence: 廣果諸天，壽命八劫；
translation: The Bṛhatphala gods had a life span of eight world ages.

source_sentence: 無想諸天，壽十六劫；
translation: The non-thought heavens have a life span of sixteen eons.

source_sentence: 不熱諸天，壽命千劫；
translation: The A Forest of Pearls from the Dharma Garden, Volume II The gods in the Heaven of No Heat have a life span of one thousand world ages.

source_sentence: 無惱諸天，壽二千劫；
translation: The Anāgāmideva gods had a life span of two thousand world ages.

source_sentence: 善見諸天，壽三千劫；
translation: The Sudarśana gods had a life span of one thousand world ages.

source_sentence: 善現諸天，壽四千劫；
translation: The Sudarśana gods had a life span of four thousand world ages.

source_sentence: 色究竟天，壽五千劫；
translation: The final form heaven has a life span of five thousand world ages.

source_sentence: 虛空處天，壽十千劫；
translation: The space deities had a life span of ten thousand world ages.

source_sentence: 識處天，壽二萬一千劫；
translation: The consciousness heaven has a life span of twenty-one thousand world ages.

source_sentence: 無所有處天，壽四萬二千劫；
translation: The Gods of the realm of nothingness had a life span of forty-two thousand eons.

source_sentence: 非想非非想處天，壽八萬四千劫；
translation: The neither-thought-nor-non-thought heaven has a life span of eighty-four thousand eons.

source_sentence: 於其中間，並皆有夭。
translation: Among them, all of them died.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！

source_sentence: 閻浮提人，身長三肘半，衣廣中七肘，上下三肘半；
translation: The people of Jambudvīpa are three and a half zhou in height, with robes that are seven zhou in width and three and a half zhou above and below.

source_sentence: 瞿陀尼人、弗婆提人，身量及衣，與閻浮等；
translation: The people of Godānīya and Pūrvavideha are the same in size as Jambudvīpa in terms of their bodies, with the exception of the fourth and fifth.

source_sentence: 其欝多囉究留人，身長七肘，衣廣中十四肘，上下七肘；
translation: The people of Uttarakuru are seven zhou in height and their garments are fourteen zhou in width, seven zhou high and seven zhou low.

source_sentence: 阿修囉身，長一踰闍那，衣廣中二踰闍那，上下一踰闍那，重半迦利沙；
translation: The body of the asura was one yojana long, its robes two yojanas in width and one yojana high and weighing half as much as grains of sand.

source_sentence: 四天王身，長半踰闍那，衣廣中一踰闍那，上下半踰闍那，重一迦利沙；
translation: The bodies of the four guardian gods are one yojana long in length, with robes that are one yojana wide and weigh as much as a grain of khadiri sand.

source_sentence: 三十三天，身長一踰闍那，衣廣中二踰闍那，上下一踰闍那，重半迦利沙；
translation: The gods of the thirty-threefold heaven are one yojana tall, with robes that are two yojanas in width and one yojana high and weighing half as much as grains of sand.

source_sentence: 夜摩天，身長二踰闍那，衣廣中四踰闍那，上下二踰闍那，重一迦利沙四分之一；
translation: The gods of Yama Heaven are two yojanas in height, with robes measuring four yojanas in width and weighing one-quarter of a liang of the sand.

source_sentence: 兜率陀天，身長四踰闍那，衣廣八踰闍那，上下四踰闍那，重一迦利沙八分之一；
translation: The gods of the Tuṣita Heaven are four yojanas in height and their bodies are four yojanas in height. Their robes are eight yojanas wide and weigh one-eighth of a grain of khattiya sand, which is four yojanas in height above and below.

source_sentence: 化樂天，身長八踰闍那，衣廣十六踰闍那，上下八踰闍那，重一迦利沙十六分之一；
translation: The Nirmāṇaratideva gods are eight yojanas in height with bodies eight yojanas in height and their robes sixteen yojanas in width. Eight yojanas above and below them weigh one-sixteenth of the heaviest grain of khattiya sand.

source_sentence: 他化自在天，身長十六踰闍那，衣廣三十二踰闍那，上下十六踰闍那，
translation: The Paranirmitavaśavartin gods are sixteen yojanas in height and their bodies are thirty-two yojanas long and sixteen yojanas high.

source_sentence: 重一迦利沙三十二分之一；
translation: It weighed one sheng of the thirty-twothree parts of the sands of Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 魔身諸天，身長三十二踰闍那，衣廣六十四踰闍那，上下三十二踰闍那，
translation: The gods of Māra’s body are thirty-two yojanas in height and their robes are sixty-four yojanas in width, measuring thirty-two yojanas above and below.

source_sentence: 重一迦利沙六十四分之一。
translation: It weighs one-sixty-fourth of a liang of Kālīṣa.

source_sentence: 自此已上，諸天身量長短，與衣正等無差。
translation: From here on, the gods' bodies are exactly the same in size and length as their robes.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 閻浮提人，所有市買，或以錢財、或以穀帛、或以眾生；
translation: The people of Jambudvfpa buy whatever they have in the marketplace, whether with money or goods, grain or silk, or by means of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 瞿陀尼人，所欲市買，或以牛羊、或摩尼寶；
translation: The people of [Apara]godānīya wanted to buy what they wished at market, some of which were cow and sheep or precious maṇi treasures.

source_sentence: 弗婆提人，若作市易，或以財帛、或以五穀、或摩尼寶；
translation: The people of Pūrvavideha may offer their goods, silk, or five grains, or precious jewels to anyone who wishes to trade them.

source_sentence: 欝多囉究留人輩，無諸市買，所欲自然。
translation: The people of Uttarakuru had no markets to buy, and their desires were naturally present.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 閻浮提人、瞿陀尼人、弗婆提人，悉有男婚女嫁之法；
translation: The people of Jambudvipa, the people of Godānīya and the people of Pūrvavideha all have the custom of male and female marriage.

source_sentence: 其欝多囉究留人輩，無我我所，樹枝若垂，男女便合，無有婚嫁。
translation: The people of Uttarakuru have no self or possessions, and if a tree with branches hanging down its male and female members are united, there's no marriage.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 龍、金翅鳥及阿修囉輩，略說嫁娶，悉如人間；
translation: All the dragons, garuḍas, garuḍas, and asuras are said to be married just like people in the human world.

source_sentence: 四天王天、三十三天、夜摩諸天、兜率陀天、化樂諸天、他化自在諸天、魔身天等，
translation: The four heavenly kings, the Trāyastriṃśa gods, the Yama gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods, the Māra-body gods, and so forth.

source_sentence: 皆有嫁娶，略說如前。
translation: They all have marriage, as briefly explained above.

source_sentence: 從此已上其諸天等，無復婚嫁男女之別。
translation: From here on, there's no more distinction between marriage and men and women in the heavens above these gods.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 閻浮提人，若行欲時，二根相到，流出不淨；
translation: When people in Jambudvfpa indulge in sexual desire, their two faculties are mutually exclusive and the flowing out is impure.

source_sentence: 瞿陀尼人、弗婆提人，并欝多囉究留人輩，悉如閻浮提；
translation: The people of Godānīya and Upagupta, as well as the inhabitants of Uttarakuru, were all like Jambudvfpa.

source_sentence: 一切諸龍、金翅鳥等，若行欲時，亦二根到，但出風氣，即便暢情，無有不淨；
translation: All the dragons and garuḍas also have two faculties when they are engaged in sensual desires. They emit only a wind that exhales, and their emotions are neither defiled nor unclean.

source_sentence: 諸阿修羅、四天王天、三十三天，行欲根到，暢情出氣，如諸龍王及金翅鳥，
translation: The asuras, the gods of the four heavenly kings and the Trāyastriṃśa gods are endowed with the faculty of desire. They emanate their vitality like the dragon kings and the garuḍas.

source_sentence: 一種無異；
translation: There is no difference between one kind and another.

source_sentence: 夜摩諸天，執手成欲；
translation: The Yama gods grasped their hands and became attached to sensual desire.

source_sentence: 兜率陀天，憶念成欲；
translation: The Tuṣita gods remembered the fulfillment of their desires.

source_sentence: 化樂諸天，熟視成欲；
translation: The Nirmāṇaratideva gods matured their cravings by looking at each other.

source_sentence: 他化自在天，共語成欲；
translation: The Paranirmita-vaśavartin gods share the same speech and develop desire.

source_sentence: 魔身諸天，相看成欲；
translation: The gods in the realm of Māra see each other and become attached to desire.

source_sentence: 並皆暢心，成其欲事。
translation: They all had a peaceful mind and fulfilled their desires.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 論其人間，螢火之明，則不如彼燈火之明；
translation: When we talk of the people there, the light of a firefly is not as bright as that of a lamp.

source_sentence: 燈火之明，又不如彼炬火之明；
translation: The light of a lamp is not as bright as that of a torch.

source_sentence: 其炬火明，又不如彼火聚之明；
translation: The light of the torch is not as bright as that of a cluster of flames.

source_sentence: 其火聚明，不及諸天星宿光明；
translation: The light of the fire cluster is not as bright as that of the constellations and celestial objects.

source_sentence: 其星宿明，又不及彼月宮殿明；
translation: The stars and constellations are not as bright as those of the moon palace.

source_sentence: 月宮殿明，又不及日宮殿光明；
translation: The light of the moon palace is not as bright as the light of the sun palace.

source_sentence: 其日宮殿照耀光明，又不及彼四天王天牆壁宮殿身瓔珞明；
translation: The palace of the sun shone as brightly as those of the four heavenly kings, whose walled palaces and bodies were adorned with jewelry.

source_sentence: 四天王天諸有光明，則又不及三十三天所有光明；
translation: The light of the gods of the four heavenly kings is not as bright as that of the thirty-three celestial beings.

source_sentence: 其三十三天諸有光明，則又不及夜摩諸天牆壁宮殿瓔珞光明；
translation: The light of the thirty-three celestial beings is not as bright as that of the night gods’ walls, palaces, and diadems.

source_sentence: 其夜摩天所有諸光，則不及彼兜率陀天所有光明；
translation: The light emitted by the night god Yama is not as bright as that of the Tuṣita gods.

source_sentence: 兜率陀天所有諸明，則又不及化樂天明；
translation: The luminosity of the Tushita gods is not as great as that of the Nirmāṇarati gods.

source_sentence: 其化樂天所有光明，則不及彼他化自在諸天光明；
translation: The light of the Nirmāṇarati gods is not as bright as that of the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods.

source_sentence: 他化自在所有光明，則又不及魔身天明；
translation: The light that emanates from the power of teaching others is not as bright as that of the gods in Māra’s heavenly body.

source_sentence: 其魔身天牆壁宮殿瓔珞身光，比於在下，最勝最妙，殊特無過。
translation: The light of the demon-body celestial walled palace and its diadem body is superior and most marvelous, extraordinary and unsurpassed by those below it.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 其魔身天，比梵身天則又不及；
translation: The gods in Māra’s heaven are inferior to the gods in Brahmā’s heaven.

source_sentence: 其梵身天，比光憶念天則又不及；
translation: The gods in the Brahmakāyika Heaven are inferior to the gods in the Luminosity and recollection Heaven.

source_sentence: 其光憶念天比遍淨天，則又不及；
translation: That ray of light was not as bright as that of the universally pure celestial constellation Reminder.

source_sentence: 其遍淨天；
translation: The pervasively pure celestial.

source_sentence: 比廣果天光則不及；
translation: It is not as vast as the light of Vaiśravaṇa Heaven.

source_sentence: 彼廣果天，如是略說，無惱熱天、善見、善現、阿迦膩吒天等，唯除瓔珞，
translation: In brief, the Vaiśravaṇa gods are like this:

source_sentence: 餘如上說，應如是知。
translation: The rest are as has been said above: they should be known in this way.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 若天世界，及諸魔梵，沙門婆羅門人等，世間所有光明，欲比如來阿羅訶三藐三佛陀光明，
translation: If the gods, worlds, Māras, Brahmās, ascetics, priests, and so forth, were to desire the Tathāgata's light of arhatship, correct enlightenment,

source_sentence: 百千萬億恒河沙數，不可為比。
translation: It is one hundred thousand myriads of koṭis of Ganges River sands in number and cannot be compared to it.

source_sentence: 此如來光，最勝最妙，殊特第一。
translation: This Tathāgata’s ray of light is the most superior and marvelous, with distinctions that make it the best.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 其如來身，戒行無量、三摩提、般若、解脫、解脫知見，神通及神通行，
translation: The body of the Tathāgata was immeasurable in morality, concentration, absorption, wisdom, liberation, knowledge and vision of liberation, spiritual powers, and supernormal abilities.

source_sentence: 教化及教化輪，說處及說處輪等，並各無量無邊。
translation: The instruction and the wheel of instruction, the locus of explanation and the locus of explanation, etc., are each immeasurable and limitless.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 如來如是無量功德，一切諸法，皆悉具足。
translation: The Tathāgata has such measureless merits, and all the teachings are fully endowed with them.

source_sentence: 以是義故，如來光明，最勝無上，當如是持。
translation: Because of this meaning, the Tathāgata's light is the most superior and unsurpassed, so he should thus maintain it.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 一切眾生，有四種食，以資諸大，得住持故、成諸有故、相攝受故。
translation: All sentient beings have four kinds of food that provide support for the great ones, because they attain sustained existence, become existent, and are collected by each other.

source_sentence: 何等為四？
translation: What are these four?

source_sentence: 一者麤段及微細食，二者觸食，三者意思食，四者識食。
translation: The first is food by the mouthful and subtle; the second is food by touch; the third is food by thought; and the fourth is food by consciousness.

source_sentence: 何等眾生，應食麤段及微細食？
translation: What kinds of sentient beings should eat gross and subtle food?

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 閻浮提人，飯食麨豆及魚肉等，此等名為麤段之食；
translation: The people of Jambudvfpa eat rice, edible millet and beans as well as fish and meat. These are called coarse food.

source_sentence: 覆蓋按摩，澡浴揩拭，脂膏塗等，此悉名為微細之食。
translation: These are all called subtle foods that cover, massage, bathe, wipe, moisten, and rub it with grease and ointment.

source_sentence: 瞿陀尼人、弗婆提人，麤段微細，略說與前閻浮提等。
translation: The people of Godānīya and Pūrvavideha are coarse and minute in size, roughly the same as the people of Jambudvīpa.

source_sentence: 其欝多囉究留人輩，身不耕種，自然而有成熟粳米，以為麤段；
translation: The people of Uttarakuru did not plow or sow their crops, but they naturally ate cooked millet to make rice into grain by themselves.

source_sentence: 覆蓋澡浴，及按摩等，為微細食。
translation: Covering, bathing, and massage are subtle foods.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 一切諸龍及金翅鳥等，以諸魚鼈黿鼉、蝦蟇、虬螭、蛇獺、金毘羅等，
translation: All the dragons, garuḍas, frogs, crocodiles, turtles, serpents, otterflies, and other such creatures are like this.

source_sentence: 是彼麤段；
translation: This is the coarse section.

source_sentence: 諸覆蓋等，是彼微細。
translation: The obscurations, etc., are the subtleties of these.

source_sentence: 諸阿修羅，以天須陀妙好之味，以為麤段；
translation: The asura demons took the delicious taste of celestial stream entry as food.

source_sentence: 諸覆蓋等，以為微細。
translation: The coverings and so forth are thought to be subtle.

source_sentence: 四天王天及諸天輩，皆用彼天須陀之味，以為麤段；
translation: The gods of the four heavenly kings and other celestial beings all took the taste of that heavenly fruit and made it into rice gruel.

source_sentence: 諸覆蓋等，以為微細。
translation: The coverings and so forth are thought to be subtle.

source_sentence: 三十三天，以須陀味，為天麤段；
translation: The thirty-three gods of Trāyastriṃśa Heaven take the taste of stream entry as heavenly food.

source_sentence: 諸覆蓋等，以為微細。
translation: The coverings and so forth are thought to be subtle.

source_sentence: 略說猶如三十三天，其夜摩天、兜率陀天、化樂諸天、他化自在天等，
translation: In brief, it's like the Trāyastriṃśa gods: those in Yama Heaven, Tuṣita Heaven, Nirmāṇarati Heaven, and Paranirmitavaśavartin Heaven

source_sentence: 並皆用天須陀之味，以為麤段；
translation: They all used the taste of celestial sweetness as their condiment.

source_sentence: 諸覆蓋等，以為微細。
translation: The coverings and so forth are thought to be subtle.

source_sentence: 自此已上，諸天眾輩，並以禪悅法喜為食、三摩提為食、三摩跋提為食，
translation: From that time forth, the gods and other celestial beings all ate meditative bliss of the joy of the Dharma; samādhi and absorption were their nutriments.

source_sentence: 無復麤段及微細食。
translation: There's no more crude or subtle food.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 何等眾生，以觸為食？
translation: Which sentient beings take sense perception as food?

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 有諸眾生，從卵生者，所謂鵝鴈鴻鶴、雞鴨孔雀、鸚鵡鸜鵒、鳩鴿燕雀雉鵲等，
translation: Some sentient beings are born from eggs, which are called geese, frogs, big cranes, foxes, ducks, parrots, pigeons, swans, pheasants, and magpies.

source_sentence: 自餘種種雜類眾生從卵生者，以其從卵有此身故，是等並皆以觸為食。
translation: The other beings of various kinds that arise from eggs are all nutried by sense perception because they have this body born from eggs.

source_sentence: 何等眾生，以思為食？
translation: Which sentient beings take volition as food?

source_sentence: 若有眾生，以意思惟，資潤諸根，增長身命，所謂魚鼈龜蛇蝦蟆及以伽羅瞿陀等，
translation: Suppose there are sentient beings who, by mentally contemplating, nourish their faculties and increase their physical life: so-called fish, turtles, tortoises, snakes, frogs, toads, garuḍas, etc.

source_sentence: 自餘所有諸眾生類，以意思惟，潤益諸根，增長命者，此等並皆用思為食。
translation: All the other sentient beings who nourish their faculties and increase their life by mentally contemplating, all use thought as food for them.

source_sentence: 何等眾生，以識為食？
translation: What kinds of sentient beings take consciousness as food?

source_sentence: 所謂地獄諸眾生輩，及識無邊諸天輩等。
translation: They are the so-called sentient beings in hell and the gods of limitless consciousness.

source_sentence: 此等眾生，並皆用識，持以為食。
translation: These sentient beings all use consciousness to maintain it as food.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 此四種食，為眾生輩，住持諸大，攝受生故。
translation: These four kinds of nutriment are for the sake of living beings. They abide and support the elements: because they take in birth.

source_sentence: 「花色及諸法，　　壽命衣第五，
translation: Flower colors and dharmas, life spans, and the fifth garment.

source_sentence: 市買并嫁娶，　　二根食為十。
translation: The food of the two organs constitutes ten:

source_sentence: 於中有優陀那偈：「諸比丘！
translation: In the midst of this, there's a verse by Udāna, saying, Monks!

source_sentence: 世間眾生，皆悉有此三種惡行。
translation: All sentient beings in the world have these three kinds of bad actions.

source_sentence: 何等為三？
translation: What are these three?

source_sentence: 所謂身惡、口惡、意惡。
translation: It's called bad in body, bad in speech, and bad in thought.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 有一種類，以身惡行口意惡行，如是作已，彼因緣故，身壞命終，當墮惡趣生地獄中。
translation: There is a certain kind of people who commit evil deeds of body, speech, and mind. Having done so, because of these causes and conditions, at the breaking up of the body at death they will be reborn in a bad realm of existence, being reborn in hell.

source_sentence: 彼於此中，最後識滅，地獄中識初相續生。
translation: Here, the last consciousness ceases, and in hell, the first consciousness arises in a series.

source_sentence: 彼識共生，即有名色，緣名色故，即生六入。
translation: Together with these conscious constructs, there arises name and form: because of the supporting object name and form. That is to say, six sense-fields arise:

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 復有一種，以身惡行口意惡行，如是作已，彼因緣故，身壞命終，墮於惡趣，
translation: There is another kind: when one commits evil bodily, verbal, or mental actions in this way, because of these causes and conditions, at the breaking up of the body at death, he falls into a bad rebirth.

source_sentence: 生畜生中。
translation: He'll be born among animals.

source_sentence: 彼於此中，最後識滅，畜生中識初相續生。
translation: Here, the last consciousness ceases, and in the animal world, the first consciousness arises in a series.

source_sentence: 當於彼識共生之時，即有名色，緣名色故，便生六入。
translation: When consciousness arises together with it, name and form exactly are the six sense-fields that arise.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 復有一種，以身惡行、口意惡行，如是作已，彼因緣故，身壞命終，墮於惡趣，
translation: “Furthermore, there is another kind: because of bad conduct in body, bad conduct in speech and bad conduct in thought. Having done so, due to these causes and conditions, at the breaking up of the body at death they will fall into a bad rebirth.

source_sentence: 生閻摩世。
translation: He was born in the Yama world.

source_sentence: 彼於此中，最後識滅，閻摩世識初相續生。
translation: In this state, the last consciousness ceases, and the first series of Yama consciousnesses arises.

source_sentence: 當於彼識初生之時，即共名色一時俱生，緣名色故，六入即生。
translation: When this consciousness first arises, it is simultaneous with name and form at one and the same time. Because name and form take name and form as supporting object, the six sense-fields exactly arise.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 此等名為三種惡行，應當遠離。
translation: These are called the three kinds of bad actions that should be avoided.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 世間復有三種善行。
translation: Again, there are three kinds of good actions in the world.

source_sentence: 何等為三？
translation: What are these three?

source_sentence: 所謂身善行、口意善行。
translation: It's called good physical practice and good verbal and mental practice.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 有一種類，身作善行、口意善行，如是習已，彼因緣故，身壞命終，生於人道。
translation: There is a certain kind of people who do good deeds with their bodies, they do good deeds with their mouths and with their thoughts. Having done so, because of these causes and conditions, at the breaking up of the body at death they are reborn in the human realm.

source_sentence: 彼於此處，最後識滅，人道中識初相續生。
translation: At this point, the last consciousness ceases, and in the human path, the first consciousness arises in a series.

source_sentence: 當於彼識初生之時，即共名色一時同生，緣名色故，六入便生。
translation: When this consciousness first arises, it simultaneously arise at one and the same time with name and form. Because name and form are the supporting object, the six sense-fields immediately arise.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 復有一種，以身善行、口意善行，如是作已，彼因緣故，身壞命終，生於天上，
translation: “Other bhikṣus, there is another case in which when a bhikṣu has performed good deeds of body, speech, and mind he will be reborn in heaven after having done so.

source_sentence: 此處識滅，彼天上識初相續生。
translation: In this state, when consciousness ceases, the first mental consciousness in heaven arises again and again.

source_sentence: 彼識生時，即共名色一時俱生，有名色故，即生六入。
translation: When this consciousness arises, it is simultaneously produced at one and the same time with name and form. Because of name and form, six sense-fields exactly arise:

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 彼於天中，或在天子、或在天女，加趺處生、或兩膝內髀股間生。
translation: Among the gods, some are born in heavenly maidens or goddesses, and some are born between the thighs of their knees or between the thighs of their feet.

source_sentence: 初出之時，狀如人間十二歲兒。
translation: When he first emerged, he looked like a twelve-year-old child in the world.

source_sentence: 若是天男，即於天子坐膝邊生；
translation: If it is a heavenly boy, he will be born at the side of the gods’ children’s knees.

source_sentence: 若是天女，即天玉女髀股內生。
translation: If it's a goddess, that is, a heavenly jadelike woman born inside her thighs and feet.

source_sentence: 如是生已，彼天即稱是我兒女，如是應知。
translation: After he's born like this, that god is called my child or daughter, as you should know.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 修善生天，有如是法。
translation: Such is the teaching of the gods who cultivate good birth.

source_sentence: 若初生時，是諸天子及天女等，以自業因所熏習故，生三種念：一者自知從何處死、二者自知今此處生、三者知此生是何業果是何福報，
translation: When they are born for the first time, these gods and goddesses, being perfumed by their own karmic causes, give rise to three kinds of thoughts: 1. They know where they die; 2. they know where they are born now; 3. they know what is the result of this birth; 4. they know what is the fruit of that action; and 5. they know what is the retribution of merit.

source_sentence: 以我彼處身命壞已，來生此間。
translation: It's because my body and life in that place have been destroyed, and I came to be born here.

source_sentence: 又如是念：『緣我有是三種業果三種業熟，得來生此。
translation: They also think, 'It's because I have these three kinds of karma and the results of these three kinds of karma that I'll be born here in the future.

source_sentence: 何者為三？
translation: What are these three?

source_sentence: 所謂身善行、口意善行。
translation: It's called good physical practice and good verbal and mental practice.

source_sentence: 此等三業，果報熟故，身壞命終，來於此處。』
translation: These three actions have ripened as their results, so when the body breaks up and life ends, they come here.'

source_sentence: 復作是念：『願我今於此處死已，當生人間。
translation: They also think, 'May I now die here and be born among humans!'

source_sentence: 我於彼處，如是生已，還修身口及意善行。
translation: After I'm thus born there, I'll again cultivate good physical, verbal, and mental actions.

source_sentence: 以身口意行善行故，身壞敗已，還來此生。』
translation: It's because of the good conduct of body, speech, and thought that their bodies disintegrate and return back to this place after they've done so.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，即便思食。
translation: After he had this thought, he even considered food.

source_sentence: 彼念食時，即於彼前，有眾寶器，自然盛滿，天須陀味，種種出生。
translation: When he thought of eating, there's a container of various treasures in front of him that naturally fills it up with the taste of heavenly sūtra, which is produced in various ways.

source_sentence: 若天子中，有勝上者，彼須陀味其色最白；
translation: If there is a superior among the celestial beings, their taste of stream-entry is the whitest in color.

source_sentence: 若其天子，果報中者，彼須陀味其色即赤；
translation: If the celestial being is middling in retribution, his taste of stream entry will be red in color.

source_sentence: 若有天子，福德下者，彼須陀味其色現黑。
translation: Suppose there's a celestial child whose virtue is inferior, and his color appears black when he tastes the taste of stream entry.

source_sentence: 時，彼天子即以手取天須陀味，內於口中，彼須陀味，既入天口，即自漸漸融消變化。
translation: That celestial being then took the taste of the heavenly sūtra with his hand and put it in his mouth. The taste of the sūtra entered the god's mouth, and it gradually melted and disappeared on its own.

source_sentence: 譬如酥及生酥擲置火中，即自融消，無有形影。
translation: It's like tossing butter and raw butter into a fire, which are spontaneously melted and disappeared without form or shadow.

source_sentence: 如是如是，天須陀味，置於口中，自然消化，亦復如是。
translation: So it is, so it is. The taste of the heavenly stream is placed in your mouth and naturally digested, just as it is.

source_sentence: 食須陀已，若其渴時，即於彼前，有天寶器，盛滿天酒，福上中下，白赤黑色，
translation: When he eats it, if he's thirsty, there's a divine treasure vessel in front of him that fills with divine wine, which is superior, middling, and inferior in merit, white, red, and black.

source_sentence: 略說如前，入口消化，融消亦爾。
translation: The same applies to the one through inhalation and to the one through digestion.

source_sentence: 時，彼天子食飲訖已，而其身體，上下大小，如彼舊生諸天子天女等。
translation: When that celestial being had finished eating and drinking, his body was as large and small as the gods and goddesses of old.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 若諸天子及諸天女，身體既充，各隨意向或詣池邊。
translation: If the gods and goddesses are fully endowed, they may go to the edge of the pond as they wish.

source_sentence: 到池邊已，入彼池內，澡浴清淨，歡喜受樂。
translation: When they arrived at the edge of the pond, they entered the lake and bathed in pure water. They were delighted and enjoyed a pleasant bath.

source_sentence: 既出池上，詣香樹邊。
translation: He emerged from the pond and went to the edge of a fragrant tree.

source_sentence: 時，彼香樹枝自然低，從枝中出種種妙香，流入手中，即以塗身。
translation: The branches of that fragrant tree then naturally fell down, and from those branches rose various kinds of wonderful fragrance, which flowed into the body and rubbed it on it.

source_sentence: 復詣衣樹，到已如前，亦為之低，而彼樹中，又出種種微妙好衣，至手邊已，
translation: He went to the tree where he wore his clothes and, having arrived there, did as he had done before. It was also low for him. And from that tree came out all kinds of exquisitely beautiful pieces of cloth, reaching up to the edge of his hands.

source_sentence: 即取而著。
translation: That is, it's grasped and attached.

source_sentence: 既著衣已，詣瓔珞樹，如是自低，垂流入手，或繫或著，以莊嚴身。
translation: After putting on his robes, he went to the jewelry tree and thus lowered himself down like this, draped his hair over his body in a stream, tied it or attached it, to adorn his body.

source_sentence: 如是復詣華鬘樹所，如前低垂，流出種種妙好華鬘。
translation: Thus, he went to the flower garland tree and descended down as before, producing a variety of exquisitely beautiful flower garlands that flowed.

source_sentence: 持飾頭已，便向器樹，樹出種種眾寶雜器，隨意入手，將詣果林，盛種種果，
translation: Having decorated their heads, they went to the container tree. From that tree came out a variety of vessels made of various jewels. They obtained whatever they wished and proceeded on their way to the fruit grove, where they were able to store up all kinds of fruits.

source_sentence: 或即噉食，或取汁飲。
translation: Or they may eat it, or they may take juice and drink it.

source_sentence: 如是復詣音樂樹邊，樹亦低垂，自然而出種種樂器，隨意而取，或彈或打、或歌或舞，
translation: In the same way, when they go to the edge of a tree that produces music, the trees also fall down and naturally produce all kinds of musical instruments. They may play or beat, sing or dance as they wish.

source_sentence: 音聲微妙，即便詣向林苑之中。
translation: The sound was so subtle that they even went to the forest and park.

source_sentence: 入苑中已，於彼即見無量無邊百數千數無量百千萬億之數諸天玉女。
translation: After entering the park, they'll see measureless and limitless hundreds of thousands of measureless hundreds of millions of heavenly jade maidens there.

source_sentence: 若未見女，所有前世知見業報：『我從何處而來生此，如我此身，今受斯報。』
translation: If someone hasn't seen a woman, they'll know the results of their past lives and see the results of their actions: 'Where did I come from to be born here? Like this body of mine, I'll now experience these results.'

source_sentence: 果業熟故，彼於此時，了了分明，憶宿世事，猶如指掌。
translation: Because of the maturation of their fruitful actions, at that point they comprehend and clearly remember past events as if they were fingers or palms.

source_sentence: 以見天女，迷諸色故，正念覺察智心即滅，既失前生，著現在欲，口唯唱言：『天玉女耶！
translation: Seeing that the goddess was deluded about form, she correctly perceived and investigated her mind of wisdom and then ceased. Having lost her previous existence, she became attached to present desires and simply said in her mouth, 'Is it a heavenly jadelike woman?'

source_sentence: 天玉女耶！』
translation: Is a heavenly jadelike woman!'

source_sentence: 如是名為欲愛之縛。
translation: Thus, this is called the bond of desire and craving.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 此則名為三種善行。
translation: These are called the three kinds of good actions.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 一月之中，有六烏晡沙他(烏晡沙他隋言受齋亦云增長)，白月半助，
translation: Within a month, there are six uṣaṭas (also called growing in Uṣaṭa). The white moon is half an assisting month.

source_sentence: 有十五日，黑月半助，亦十五日，如此白黑二月，各有三受齋日。
translation: There are fifteen days, and the black moon has a half-monthly duration of duration; there are also fifteen days. In the same way, in the two months of white and black, each has three days for fasting.

source_sentence: 何等白月三受齋日？
translation: What are the three white moon days of fasting?

source_sentence: 所謂月八日、十四日、十五日。
translation: It's called the eighth, fourteenth, and fifteenth days of the month.

source_sentence: 黑月亦有三受齋日，如白月數。
translation: In the black months, there are also three days of fasting, as in the white months.

source_sentence: 云何名為白黑二月各有三日，受於齋戒？
translation: What are the three days in each of the second month, white and black, when one receives the precepts?

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 白黑二月，各有八日。
translation: In the second month, white and black, there are eight days each.

source_sentence: 當於是日，四天大王，集其眷屬而告之言：『汝等可往普觀四方，頗有人輩，
translation: On that day, the great kings of the four quarters gathered their retinues and said to them:

source_sentence: 於世間中，多行孝順，供養父母，恭敬沙門婆羅門不？
translation: Among the people in the world, are they mostly filial and obedient, supporting their parents and paying respect to śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas?

source_sentence: 於諸尊長崇重以不？
translation: Is it venerated by the venerable ones?

source_sentence: 修行布施受禁戒不？
translation: Do you cultivate generosity and receive the precepts?

source_sentence: 守攝八關持六齋不？』
translation: Do you observe the eight precepts and maintain the six precepts?'

source_sentence: 時，四天王如是教勅其使者已，而彼使者如天王命，承奉而行，即下遍觀一切世人，
translation: The four heavenly kings then instructed their messengers in this way, but the messengers did so according to the gods’ command and carried out their duty.

source_sentence: 是誰家中，孝養父母；
translation: Whose house is the one who looks after his parents with filial piety?

source_sentence: 有何族姓，恭敬沙門婆羅門等；
translation: “World-honored One, what caste is it that venerates śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas?

source_sentence: 誰家男女，敬事尊長；
translation: Men and women of different families honored the venerated ones.

source_sentence: 誰行布施；
translation: Who will practice giving?

source_sentence: 誰受六齋；
translation: Who will undergo the six kinds of purification?

source_sentence: 誰持八禁；
translation: Who keeps the eight precepts?

source_sentence: 誰守戒德。
translation: Who observes the virtue of morality?

source_sentence: 爾時，使者如是遍歷世間觀察。
translation: At that point, the messenger thus pervades the world and observes it.

source_sentence: 見於人中，孝順供奉父母者少，承事尊重沙門者少，祇敬宿舊婆羅門於諸長者崇敬亦少，
translation: Among the people, few are filial and obedient to their parents. Few serve and venerate śramaṇas. The brāhmaṇas of Jīvaka’s contemporaries have little respect or reverence toward the wealthy householders.

source_sentence: 布施微薄，受齋稀踈，護戒不全，禁守多缺。
translation: Their almsgiving is weak and their observance of the precepts is scarce. They are imperfect in observing the disciplinary rules and there are many shortcomings in guarding the precepts.

source_sentence: 是時，天使如是見已，即便往到四天王所，而啟白言：『天王當知，其諸世間一切人輩，
translation: At that moment, having seen it thus, the divine messenger approached the four guardian gods and said to them: O king of gods! You should know that all the sentient beings in this world are likewise.

source_sentence: 無多孝養事父母者，亦無有多恭敬沙門婆羅門者，亦無有多敬重尊長耆舊德者，
translation: There are not many kind people who serve their parents with filial piety, those who have much respect for śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas, and those who have much respect for the elderly and virtuous.

source_sentence: 亦無有多修行布施持六齋者，亦無有多奉持禁戒守八關者。』
translation: Nor are there many who cultivate generosity and observe the six precepts, nor are there many who observe the eight precepts and guard the eight barriers.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，四大天王聞諸使者如是語已，意中慘然不甚歡悅，報使者言：『彼等世間，
translation: At that time, having heard these words of the messengers, the four great celestial kings were overjoyed and distressed in their hearts.

source_sentence: 若實然者，其諸人輩，甚為不善。
translation: If that's really the case, those people will be very unwholesome.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 人輩壽命，極成短促，止少時活，應修諸善，至彼後世，可得安樂。
translation: The human life span is extremely short, and when they live for a little while they should cultivate goodness so that they can attain well-being in the afterlife.

source_sentence: 云何今者彼世間人，無有多行孝養父母，乃至不能修持六齋及以八禁守攝身口？
translation: How is it that people in the world today don't often practice filial piety to their parents and can't observe the six fasts or the eight precepts to control body and speech?

source_sentence: 此大損減我諸天眾，展轉增加阿修羅種。』
translation: This great disadvantage is that we gods and goddesses will gradually increase the number of asuras.'

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 若其世間，多人恭敬孝順父母，尊重沙門婆羅門等及諸宿舊，修行布施，
translation: If there are many people in that world who respect and obey their parents, venerate śramaṇas, brāhmaṇas, and so forth, as well as those of the ancients, cultivate generosity.

source_sentence: 樂受六齋，勤建福業，恒守八禁，如是相續。
translation: They take pleasure in the observance of the six fasts and diligently perform meritorious deeds. They always observe the eight kinds of precepts, one after another, as a series.

source_sentence: 時，天使者巡察見已，上白四王：『大王當知，彼世間人，多有孝順於其父母，
translation: When the heavenly messengers saw this, they went up to the four kings and said: Great king, you should know that these people in the world are mostly filial to their parents.

source_sentence: 多有恭敬沙門婆羅門及諸尊長，樂行布施，勤修齋福。』
translation: Many respect the śramaṇas, brāhmaṇas, and other venerable people who happily practice generosity and diligently cultivate the merit of purification.'

source_sentence: 爾時，四大天王，從其使邊聞此語已，心大歡喜，踊躍無量，作如是言：『甚善甚善，
translation: At that time the four great celestial kings heard these words from their messengers, and were greatly delighted. Immeasurable with joy and ecstasy, they said:

source_sentence: 諸世間人，能如是修極大賢善。
translation: People in the world can thus cultivate the utmost great goodness.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 彼諸人輩，壽命短少，不久便當移至他世。
translation: The life spans of those people will be short, and soon they will be reborn in another world.

source_sentence: 今者乃能於彼人間，孝養父母，敬事沙門及婆羅門諸耆舊等，多樂布施，
translation: Now they can be filial to their parents and respectfully serve the śramaṇas, brāhmaṇas, and other senior citizens of that country. They are fond of giving charity.

source_sentence: 持戒守齋。
translation: He observes precepts and observes purification.

source_sentence: 如此則當增長諸天無量眷屬，損減諸阿修囉種類。』
translation: In this way, the gods will grow with measureless retinues of gods and decrease the types of asuras.'

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 云何黑白二月十四日，是烏晡沙他日？
translation: What is the other day of the fourteenth day of the second month in black and white?

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 其黑白二月十四日，四大天王，亦如是召四天太子，使其來下，觀察善惡多少，
translation: On the fourteenth day of the second month, on the fourteenth day of the black and white month, the great celestial kings of the four quarters also summoned the princes of the four quarters in the same way to come down to see how much good they did and how little evil they did.

source_sentence: 歡喜愁慘，略說悉如天使所說，唯以太子自下為異。
translation: Being delighted and grieved, he briefly explained everything as the arhat had taught it, except that the prince himself was different.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 其黑白二月十五日，烏晡沙他。
translation: On the fifteenth day of the second month in the black and white seasons, on the fifteenth day of the second month, there was Udyāna.

source_sentence: 四大天王，自下世間，躬察善惡。
translation: The great deva kings of the four elements descended from the world to examine for themselves what was good and what was bad.

source_sentence: 知多少已，即自往詣彼善法堂，到諸天集議論會處，至法堂前，面向帝釋，
translation: Knowing the amount, he went himself to that good dharma-sabhā hall. Having arrived at the place where the gods had assembled to discuss the matter, he came before the Dharma-sabhā hall and faced Indra.

source_sentence: 陳說人間善惡多少違順等事。
translation: He explains how much of the goodness and badness of humans are contradictory and so forth.

source_sentence: 爾時，帝釋聞於人間修福者少，即便慘然悵怏不樂，云何如是？
translation: At the time, when Indra heard that there were few people cultivating goodness among humans, he was so sad and disheartened that he didn't like it.

source_sentence: 天眾減少，阿修囉轉多。
translation: The number of gods decreased and the asura demons increased.

source_sentence: 若聞人間如法多者，則大歡喜踊躍無量，作如是言：『我今天眾漸當增長。』
translation: If someone hears that the people of the world are numerous according to the teaching, they'll be greatly joyful and jump up and down with immeasurable joy, saying, 'Today, I will gradually grow in number.'

source_sentence: 緣此黑白二月六日，諸天下觀人間善惡故，名此日烏晡沙他。
translation: Because it was the sixth day of the second month in the black and white seasons, when all the gods observed the good and bad among the people under heaven, this day was called Ucchuṣa Heaven.

source_sentence: 起世因本經卷第七
translation: Qishi jingben ben jing, vol. 7
